argos_summary: Bloomberg’s “Horizons Middle East & Africa” recap covers global markets, noting a hot PPI print that lifted US equities and pushed expectations for a Fed rate cut in September. The show also highlighted geopolitical developments, including a historic Trump‑Putin summit in Alaska, Israel’s plan to expand West Bank settlements, and a toxic spill at Zambia’s copper mine that could strain China‑Zambia ties. Economic updates from Asia showed Japan’s GDP beating forecasts while China’s activity data lagged, and the segment covered Saudi Arabia’s sovereign wealth fund trimming project values and Saudi carrier’s Starlink deal. Additional stories touched on South Africa’s diplomatic stance toward Iran, Standard Bank’s record profit and expansion, and a record Nigerian CPI print, underscoring the interconnectedness of finance, politics, and environmental crises.
